src:
Poncho Romo,  alerta sobre un segundo Fobaproa.
02 Nov 2019 by Reynaldo Escobar
Quien fuera uno de los más efectivos enlaces de AMLO durante su campaña presidencial, con el sector privado, don Alfonso Romo Garza, empresario nacido en el DF, multimillonario, ex dueño de Seminis, Cigarrera la Moderna, Seguros Comercial América y Presidente del Consejo Nacional para el Fomento a la inversión, el Empleo y el Crecimiento Económico, se desempeña como Jefe de la Oficina de la Presidencia y cumpliendo con su deber, ha pedido que se revise y se resuelva la debilidad del sistema bancario, ante la expectativa poco favorable de tener que recurrir a un nuevo Fobaproa.
Don Alfonso Romo, primero exitoso empresario, es uno de los más cercanos colaboradores del Presidente, es sobrino nieto de don Francisco I. Madero, expresidente de la República (1911-1913).
Romo proviene de la estirpe de una familia rica e influyente de Coahuila, quienes como dato cultural, antes del inicio de la lucha de Madero por el “sufragio efectivo y la no reelección”, eran dueños del único horno de fundición en el norte de México.
El proyecto de nación de López Obrador en la pasada elección presidencial fue elaborado en gran medida por Alfonso Romo, quien tiene amistad con el actual jefe del ejecutivo desde 2011 y ha expresado su coincidencia ideológica con su actual jefe político, pues Romo trae la herencia ideológica del expresidente Madero en la sangre y alaba el ideario político de su tío abuelo, quien en el año 1908 publicó un libro criticando la reelección presidencial y señalando que el problema de México era el absolutismo y el poder político ilimitado concentrado en un solo hombre.
Del tío abuelo, Romo aprendió la lucha por la democracia, mediante elecciones libres, que permitieran una prensa independiente y un respeto al orden jurídico vigente; así lo hizo saber a López Obrador, quien le respondió que era importante su participación porque “el renacimiento de México no es tarea de un solo hombre” y aún con la decepción de Alfonso Romo por haber apoyado a los panistas Vicente Fox y Felipe Calderón, para llegar a Los Pinos, decidió sumarse al equipo de campaña de Andrés Manuel para ganar los votos suficientes que lo llevaran al Palacio Nacional.
Romo es ingeniero agrónomo por el Tecnológico de Monterrey, pero sus conocimientos en finanzas y problemas políticos de México, son dignos de admiración hasta por sus enemigos políticos. Su alerta para no caer en un segundo Fobaproa, debe ser valorada seriamente por el señor Presidente.
Quien fuera uno de los más efectivos enlaces de AMLO durante su campaña presidencial, con el sector privado, don Alfonso Romo Garza, empresario nacido en el DF, multimillonario, ex dueño de Seminis, Cigarrera la Moderna, Seguros Comercial América y Presidente del Consejo Nacional para el Fomento a la inversión, el Empleo y el Crecimiento Económico, se desempeña como Jefe de la Oficina de la Presidencia y cumpliendo con su deber, ha pedido que se revise y se resuelva la debilidad del sistema bancario, ante la expectativa poco favorable de tener que recurrir a un nuevo Fobaproa.
Don Alfonso Romo, primero exitoso empresario, es uno de los más cercanos colaboradores del Presidente, es sobrino nieto de don Francisco I. Madero, expresidente de la República (1911-1913).
Romo proviene de la estirpe de una familia rica e influyente de Coahuila, quienes como dato cultural, antes del inicio de la lucha de Madero por el “sufragio efectivo y la no reelección”, eran dueños del único horno de fundición en el norte de México.
El proyecto de nación de López Obrador en la pasada elección presidencial fue elaborado en gran medida por Alfonso Romo, quien tiene amistad con el actual jefe del ejecutivo desde 2011 y ha expresado su coincidencia ideológica con su actual jefe político, pues Romo trae la herencia ideológica del expresidente Madero en la sangre y alaba el ideario político de su tío abuelo, quien en el año 1908 publicó un libro criticando la reelección presidencial y señalando que el problema de México era el absolutismo y el poder político ilimitado concentrado en un solo hombre.
Del tío abuelo, Romo aprendió la lucha por la democracia, mediante elecciones libres, que permitieran una prensa independiente y un respeto al orden jurídico vigente; así lo hizo saber a López Obrador, quien le respondió que era importante su participación porque “el renacimiento de México no es tarea de un solo hombre” y aún con la decepción de Alfonso Romo por haber apoyado a los panistas Vicente Fox y Felipe Calderón, para llegar a Los Pinos, decidió sumarse al equipo de campaña de Andrés Manuel para ganar los votos suficientes que lo llevaran al Palacio Nacional.
Romo es ingeniero agrónomo por el Tecnológico de Monterrey, pero sus conocimientos en finanzas y problemas políticos de México, son dignos de admiración hasta por sus enemigos políticos. Su alerta para no caer en un segundo Fobaproa, debe ser valorada seriamente por el señor Presidente.
text:
How is the Vasileostrovsky market arranged? From the breakfast area and avocado bar to the seafood corner and vegetable stalls
02 Nov 2019 by Anastasia Rozhkova
In late October, after reconstruction, the Vasileostrovsky market was fully opened. Now there is working not only a restaurant part, but also a grocery area - with craft cheeses, marbled beef and fish delicacies. A breakfast area was also launched on the central square where you can drink coffee, eat egg dishes and buy flowers. Paper tells you what you can try on the Vasileostrovsky market, and also shows an updated platform.


Photo: Egor Tsvetkov / “Paper”



Photo: Egor Tsvetkov / “Paper”



Photo: Egor Tsvetkov / “Paper”



Photo: Egor Tsvetkov / “Paper”



Photo: Egor Tsvetkov / “Paper”

The Vasileostrovsky collective farm market at the intersection of Bolshoi Prospekt and the 5th line was built in 1959. In Soviet times, they traded meat, dairy products, fruits and vegetables.
The premises of the market belong to businessman Vladimir Khurtsilave, former deputy director general of Gazprom Invest. In 2018, Kantin took the site for a long-term lease - the team included former employees of Food Retail and Ginza.
They decided to turn the Soviet market into a modern food market with corners of bars and restaurants and a breakfast area. In the summer of 2019, the gastronomic part of the site was launched, and at the end of October - the grocery.
Gastronomic part - Israeli bistro, giant portions of fo bo and desserts from the match
Since the summer of 2019, a gastronomic space has been operating on the Vasileostrovsky market with corners of 16 establishments from St. Petersburg and Moscow. Already then, about 150 million rubles were invested in the project - the money spent on a complete reconstruction of the building and the surrounding area.
Among the residents there are establishments with dishes of national cuisines - from the Italian Pio Nero to the Dagestan Bench and the Israeli bistro Easy Hummus. Japanese pastries can be tasted at Bao Mochi, Mexican tacos at San Diego, Indian curry at Indisco, rolls at Subzero, and a giant serving of Vietnamese pho bo soup at Bò.















Mikhail Filippov, Corner Manager Bò:
- Everyone knows about us, because we are preparing the most authentic cuisine, which was transferred to Russia. We have Vietnamese cooks, a simple menu, a classic of Vietnamese street food: traditional pho soup. In the Vasileostrovsky market, we decided to open up, because this is a new fashionable place. There are already many points in Moscow - at Depot, on the Danilovsky market. St. Petersburg decided to continue the tradition.
There are several vegetarian corners on the Vasileostrovsky market. In the Green Garden Café you can order olivier with avocado instead of sausage and tofu shawarma, while Avocado point prepares avocado dishes.
Nika Minaeva, chef and managing director of Avocado point:
- Avocado point - the first avocado bar in Russia, there was no alternative to us - it has already begun to appear. Then health care was just beginning to develop - that’s the avocado. In Moscow, we have four restaurants and for a long time we were looking for a place in St. Petersburg that would suit our needs. And then such a large platform appeared as the Vasileostrovsky market.
In a separate room for about ten seats, the Mad Espresso coffee shop operates. They make coffee from their own roasted beans. Unusual desserts can be found in the Love you so matcha corner, where Japanese match tea is added to the Pavlov’s muffins, pancake cakes, muffins and meringues.
Craft beer can be enjoyed at the Ontap Corner, and cocktails are served at the Salute Bar. Crabs are Coming cook Far Eastern crab, and Raw bar and grill has an ice showcase with oysters.









Mikhail Katushkin, Chef Raw bar and grill:
- We specialize in seafood. We have a small assortment, but the most hits are presented: live oysters, scallops and sea urchins. Deliveries are brought three times a week from our own aquarium, so our products are always fresh. Vasileostrovsky market is the first such project in St. Petersburg. I used to work in the Porto Maltese restaurant and often meet my guests here who want not to sit at the table, but to have a quick and inexpensive meal. It has become very fashionable now: young people generally do not want to sit at the table. And in one place you can try different products.
Breakfast Area - Coffee, American Cakes and Egg Dishes
Vasileostrovsky market has a separate breakfast area. The space is open from 8 in the morning. There you can drink coffee, try desserts, pastries, cereals and egg dishes. A flower shop opened here.
Olga Nikiforova
Development Director of Vasileostrovsky Market
- When the space was fully opened, more air appeared on the market, a beautiful prospect from all sides, and most importantly - more seats. We have opened two new territories, one of them is a round square, which has several tasks. On the one hand, it opens at 8 am, and you can come there for breakfast, on the other, you can buy something with you when you leave the grocery or restaurant part, for example, a freshly baked grain baguette, cake or a bouquet of flowers.









One of the main discoveries was the Eggsellent point - this is a very fashionable project in Moscow, which began with a weekend brunch and turned into a permanent place with perfect eggs breakfasts. This is not an easy fitness food, but a full delicious breakfast, in the morning you can!
Another project is Cake me Tender, which was done by Snezhana Tsarenko, who opened the corner you Love you so matcha in the restaurant section. These are American cakes with natural composition and berries. The city really lacks a real pastry shop, and this is an ideal place for those who want to eat a good dessert. There are also breakfasts - cereals, cheesecakes and lazy dumplings.
There must be a bakery on the market so that you can buy bread and croissants. Therefore, we faced a big problem, who to choose. We conducted many tastings and opted for the Opetit bakery - they make French hand-made bread. This is their third place after the institution at Petrograd and coffee houses at the French Institute.
“Man and Steamboat” is the legendary Moscow coffee house, which began its journey from the Danilovsky Market in Moscow. Excellent and understandable coffee is prepared in two minutes, regardless of the flow of guests.
There is also a small flower shop in the square where you can grab a lovely bouquet with you. Surprise someone or decorate your home. And soon there will appear mini-concepts - a fresh bar and a cart with small desserts.
Grocery part - craft cheeses, nut butter and marbled beef
In the grocery part of the Vasileostrovsky market, you can buy fruits, vegetables, meat and cheeses from large enterprises from all over Russia, as well as from local farmers.
Voronezh tomatoes, craft cheeses from Vsevolozhsk peasant farms, meat from the Primembiff company, which is used in many restaurants, as well as Murmansk cod and Japanese tuna are sold on the market. There is also a point with oil from thirty kinds of seeds and nuts, which is crushed by visitors, as well as a department of natural Altai sausages.
























The market management plans to launch a zero waste department, where they will sell cereals in canvas bags by weight, and a point with kosher products. On the second floor of the market there will be a cheese factory in which Italian cheeses - mozzarella, buratta and strachatella will be made. It will be created together with the Terranova brand.
According to Olga Nikiforova, Market Development Director, the fastest growing concept is a seafood corner in the gastronomic part of the space. Therefore, the market also plans to open a full-fledged fish restaurant.
